required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Natural History Study in Pediatric Patients With MYBPC3 Mutation-associated Cardiomyopathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective and Retrospective Registry and Biomarker Study to Evaluate the Natural History of Pediatric Patients With Cardiomyopathy Due to MYBPC3 Mutations

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to collect information on patients with cardiomyopathy (CM) due to mutations in the MYBPC3 gene, to evaluate their disease course, burden of illness, risk factors for this disease, and the quality of life (QoL). This study will also collect information on treatments, procedures and outcome in infants and children up to 18 yrs who have this mutation.

primary_outcome.measure: To characterize the disease course and natural history in participants with pathogenic or likely pathogenic MYBPC3 mutations with a specific focus on cardiac events and measurement
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years for prospective group, n/a for retrospective group

arm_group.description: All patients who meet the eligibility criteria will be eligible for retrospective chart review with no maximum number of patients.

100 patients meeting the eligibility criteria will be followed for 5 years, in addition to a retrospective chart review. Assessments will be completed as part of a participant's regular schedule of physician visits, no additional visits will be required. Aside from a simple annual blood draw, assessments are non-invasive, including a Quality of Life questionnaire.

study_pop.textblock: Patients under the age of 18 years (at enrollment) with cardiomyopathy (CM) and pathogenic or likely pathogenic MYBPC3 genetic mutation

criteria.textblock:
Retrospective
Inclusion Criteria:
- Data is available for patient <18 years of age.
- Documented results of genotyping showing the presence of at least one pathogenic or likely pathogenic MYBPC3 mutation (heterozygous, homozygous, or compound heterozygous).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient received cardiac transplantation or died >10 years before study initiation.
Prospective
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 at entry into the prospective study.
- Documented results of genotyping identifying at least one pathogenic or likely pathogenic MYBPC3 mutation (heterozygous, homozygous, or compound heterozygous).
- Infants who are homozygous or compound heterozygous for the known pathogenic truncating MYBPC3 mutations are eligible.
- Heterozygous participants must have a diagnosis of Cardiomyopathy (CM: HCM, DCM, RCM, mixed CM, or LVNC.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent participation in an interventional clinical trial unless approved by the sponsor.
- Severe noncardiac disease is anticipated to significantly reduce life expectancy.

facility.name: DDC Clinic Center for Special Needs Children
